noun.description: A stereoscopic photograph with the two images superimposed and printed in different colors, producing a stereo effect when the photograph is viewed through correspondingly colored filters.
An object, such as a cameo, embossed or carved in low relief.

origin: Late 16th century (in anaglyph (sense 2)): from Greek anagluphē, from ana- up + gluphē (from gluphein carve). anaglyph (sense 1) dates from the late 19th century.
